subject: Philosophy
title: Can Art Change the World?
description: A short lesson to help you apply Can Art Change the World?.

hook.text: Uncle Tom's Cabin helped ignite the Civil War. Lincoln reportedly said so himself.

buildup.text: Art reaches emotions that arguments can't. A novel can shift views faster than a policy paper.

discovery.text: Picasso's Guernica turned the horror of war into a global symbol of anti-violence.

twist.text: Authoritarian regimes censor, burn, and ban art. That itself proves its power.

climax.text: Art doesn't just reflect the world. It reshapes how people see it ‚Äî and that changes everything.

punchline.text: The pen really is mightier than the sword.

quiz.question: Why did Picasso paint Guernica?
options: To protest the horrors of war
